alert.note: Alert for Kodiak Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 22 at 3:58AM AKDT until March 22 at 6:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKDT THIS EVENING FOR WESTERN AND SOUTHERN PORTIONS OF KODIAK ISLAND... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts across interior locations of Kodiak Island. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Communities along the western and southern portions of Kodiak Island, including Larsen Bay, Karluk, Akhiok, and Old Harbor. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Strong winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A low pressure system will bring strong winds and snow for western and southern parts of Kodiak Island. The combination of snow and wind could reduce visibility to as low as one half mile at times before snow tapers off this evening. A mix of rain and snow is also expected to change to snow along northern and eastern portions of the island today as winds shift from the east to the northwest. However, warmer temperatures along the eastern half of the island will likely limit blowing snow potential.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
